title: Pastorales Martinique (Martinique Pastorals), from the Volpini Suite

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of zincograph in black on chrome yellow wove paper.

medium_display: Zincograph in black on chrome yellow wove paper
inscriptions: Signed recto, in plate, lower left, below image, in black printing ink: "Pastorales [s in reverse] Martinique Paul Gauguin"; inscribed verso, lower left, in graphite: "43.1025 / R8013"
publication_history:
Art Institute of Chicago and Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, Gauguin: Paintings, Drawings, Prints, Sculpture, exh. cat. (Art Institute of Chicago, 1959), p. 80, cat. 136.

Bogomila Welsh-Ovcharov,Vincent van Gogh and the Birth of Cloisonism, exh. cat. (Art Gallery of Ontario, 1981), p. 200, cat. 58i (ill.).

Richard R. Brettell, Françoise Cachin, Claire Frèches-Thory, and Charles F. Stuckey, The Art of Paul Gauguin, with assistance from Peter Zegers, exh. cat. (National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C./Art Institute of Chicago/New York Graphic Society Books, 1988), pp. 132, 141, cat. 75 (ill.).

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 26, cat. 6.

Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, Paul Gauguin: Pages from the Pacific, exh. cat. (Auckland City Art Gallery/Art Institute of Chicago, 1995), pp. 34, 49, cat. 4 (ill.).

Elisabeth Hodermarsky, John La Farge’s Second Paradise: Voyages in the South Seas, 1890–1891 (Yale University Press, 2010), pp. 126–27, fig. 94.
exhibition_history:
The Art Institute of Chicago, "Gauguin: Paintings, Drawings, Prints, Sculpture," February 12-March 29, 1959, p. 80, cat. 136.

Toronto, Canada, Art Gallery of Ontario, "Vincent van Gogh and the Birth of Cloisonism," January 23-March 22, 1981, pp. 194-201, cat. 58i (ill.), cat. by Bogomila Welsh-Ovcharov; traveled to the Rijksmuseum Vincent van Vogh, Amsterdam, April 9-June 14, 1981.

Washington, D.C., National Gallery of Art, "The Art of Paul Gauguin," 1988, p. 141, cat. 75 (ill.); only shown at The Art Institute of Chicago, September 17-December 11, 1988.

Auckland, New Zealand, Auckland City Art Gallery, "Paul Gauguin: Pages From the Pacific," August 4-October 15, 1995, pp. 34 and 49, cat. 4 (ill.), cat. by Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers.
provenance_text: Sold by Hellmuth Wallach (1901–1989), New York, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1943.

input: Pastorales Martinique (Martinique Pastorals), from the Volpini Suite
